parameters: CHECK THAT THE PLAYER HAS THE FISHING ROD SELECTED.
CHECK IF ENTER/SPACE/CONFIRM IS BEING PRESSED
CHECK THE X AND Y COORDINATES OF THE TILE IN FRONT OF THE PLAYER DEPENDING ON
WHICH DIRECTION THEY ARE FACING, AND STORE THEM IN TWO DIFFERENT VARIABLES.
GET THE REGION ID FOR THAT TILE IN FRONT OF THE PLAYER.
CHECK IF THE REGION ID IS 96.
96 IS THE REGION ID THAT IS SET FOR WATER THAT CAN BE FISHED IN.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER HAS THE FISHING ROD IN THEIR INVENTORY.
ASK THE PLAYER IF THEY WANT TO FISH.
Do you want to fish here?
TURN ON A SWITCH TO LOCK THE PLAYER INTO THE FISHING EVENT.
CHECK COMMON EVENT 101 TO VIEW THE FISHING EVENT.
IF THE PLAYER DOESN'T HAVE THE FISHING ROD, PLAY A MESSAGE.
DELETE THIS IF YOU WANT NOTHING TO HAPPEN, OR ADD YOUR OWN EVENTS.
You could fish here if you had a \c[3]Fishing Rod\c[0].
DISABLE THE PLAYER FROM INITIATING THE FISHING EVENT.
CHANGE PLAYER'S GRAPHIC TO A SPRITE HOLDING A ROD.
CREATE A LOOP THAT WILL WAIT A RANDOM AMOUNT OF TIME BEFORE
AN EXCLAMATION BUBBLE APPEARS ABOVE THE PLAYER'S HEAD.
CHANGE THE RANDOMIZER VARIABLE TO CHANGE HOW QUICKLY
THE PLAYER IS LIKELY TO ENCOUNTER A FISH.
IF THE RANDOMIZER IS 1, BREAK THE LOOP AND SHOW THE EXCLAMATION BUBBLE.
CREATE A LOOP THAT CHECKS IF THE PLAYER HAS PRESSED CONFIRM IN THE TIME LIMIT.
YOU CAN RANDOMIZE WHICH FISH THEY GET BY USING A VARIABLE.
ADD 1 TO THE TIME LIMIT VARIABLE.
IF THE TIME LIMIT REACHES 60, THE PLAYER LOSES THE FISH AND THE LOOP IS BROKEN.
INCREASE THIS IF YOU WISH TO GIVE THE PLAYER MORE TIME.
DELETE THIS OR ADD YOUR OWN EVENTS IF YOU WISH.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER IS PRESSING CONFIRM, EITHER BECAUSE THEY
ARE TRYING TO CANCEL OUT OF THE EVENT OR PRESSED THE BUTTON TOO SOON.
CHANGE PLAYER'S GRAPHIC BACK TO NORMAL.
ENABLE TO PLAYER TO INITIATE THE FISHING EVENT.
TURN OFF THE PLAYER FISHING SWITCH TO UNLOCK THEM FROM THE EVENT.
IF THE PLAYER STAYS UP PAST 3AM, THEY WILL BE SENT HOME TO BED.
CHANGE THIS TO ALTER HOW QUICKLY TIME FLOWS.
RANDOMISE WHICH CARD WILL APPEAR OUT OF ALL 52.
SET THE FIRST CARD TO THE RANDOM VARIABLE.
THESE ARE THE X AND Y COORDINATES THAT THE CARD WILL APPEAR ON SCREEN.
THIS ISN'T NECESSARY, BUT IS A MUCH CLEANER WAY OF HANDLING THE EVENTS.
SHOW THE PICTURE FOR THE BACK OF THE CARD AT 0 OPACITY.
USE MOVE PICTURE TO FADE THE CARD INTO VIEW.
CHANGE THE WIDTH OF THE CARD TO MAKE IT APPEAR AS THOUGH IT IS BEING FLIPPED.
DEPENDING ON WHICH NUMBER THE RANDOMIZER VARIABLE CHOSE, SHOW THE RELEVANT CARD.
ALSO SETS THE HIGH/LOW VALUE OF THAT CARD.
CHANGE THE WIDTH OF THE CARD TO MAKE IT APPEAR AS THOUGH IT IS BEING FLIPPED.
RANDOMISE WHICH CARD WILL APPEAR OUT OF ALL 52.
SET THE SECOND CARD TO THE RANDOM VARIABLE.
THESE ARE THE X AND Y COORDINATES THAT THE CARD WILL APPEAR ON SCREEN.
THIS ISN'T NECESSARY, BUT IS A MUCH CLEANER WAY OF HANDLING THE EVENTS.
SHOW THE PICTURE FOR THE BACK OF THE CARD AT 0 OPACITY.
USE MOVE PICTURE TO FADE THE CARD INTO VIEW.
CHANGE THE WIDTH OF THE CARD TO MAKE IT APPEAR AS THOUGH IT IS BEING FLIPPED.
DEPENDING ON WHICH NUMBER THE RANDOMIZER VARIABLE CHOSE, SHOW THE RELEVANT CARD.
ALSO SETS THE HIGH/LOW VALUE OF THAT CARD.
CHANGE THE WIDTH OF THE CARD TO MAKE IT APPEAR AS THOUGH IT IS BEING FLIPPED.
RANDOMIZE WHETHER THE COIN LANDS ON HEADS OR TAILS.
DEPENDING ON THE MINIGAME DIFFICULTY, SET HOW BIG THE SWEETSPOT BAR WILL BE.
THE SWEETSPOT IS THE GREEN AREA IN THE BAR WHERE THE PLAYER NEEDS TO PRESS
CONFIRM WHEN THE ARROW IS INSIDE OF IT.
SWEETSPOT MINIMUM X IS THE FURTHEST POINT LEFT ON THE BAR.
SWEETSPOT MAXIMUM X IS THE FURTHER POINT RIGHT ON THE BAR.
THE RANDOMIZER WILL PICK ANY COORDINATES WITHIN THIS RANGE,
AND THEN WE CAN CALCULATE THE MAXIMUM X BY ADDING THE
SET UP THE VARIABLE COORDINATES FOR WHERE THE ARROW WILL APPEAR.
TURN ON SWITCH FOR ARROW MOVING ANIMATION.
BEGIN A LOOP WHERE THE ARROW WILL MOVE RIGHT UNTIL IT REACHES THE
FURTHEST POINT OF THE BAR, AND THEN START TO MOVE LEFT.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER HAS PRESSED CONFIRM.
TURN OFF SWITCH FOR ARROW MOVING ANIMATION.
ADJUST ARROW X TO ACCOUNT FOR IMAGE OFFSET WHEN CALCULATING
WHETHER THE PLAYER PRESSED CONFIRM AT THE CORRECT TIME.
CHECK IF THE ARROW X IS GREATER THAN THE SWEETSPOT MINIMUM X VALUE.
CHECK IF THE ARROW X IS LESS THAN THE SWEETSPOT MAXIMUM X VALUE.
THIS MEANS THE PLAYER HAS SUCCEEDED IN PRESSING CONFIRM AT THE CORRECT TIME.
PLAY A SOUND EFFECT TO INDICATE SUCCESS OR FAILURE.
CHECK WHICH DIRECTION THE ARROW IS MOVING.
IF IT GOES TOO FAR IN ONE DIRECTION, CHANGE DIRECTION.
INCREASING THIS NUMBER CHANGES HOW FAST THE ARROW MOVES.
INCREASING THIS NUMBER CHANGES HOW FAST THE ARROW MOVES.
UPDATE THE ARROW IMAGE WITH ITS NEW X/Y POSITION.
RESET THE BUTTON MASH EVENT VARIABLE.
SHOW THE IMAGES FOR THE BME BAR.
THIS SCRIPT CALL ALLOWS YOU TO USE THE BME VARIABLE TO DETERMINE
ACTIVATE THE BME SWITCH SO THAT THE BAR WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE OVER TIME.
GO TO COMMON EVENT 115: BME BAR DECREASE TO CONFIGURE THIS.
DISPLAY AN ANIMATION FOR WHEN THE PLAYER PRESSES OKAY.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER HAS FILLED THE BAR.
IF THE BME VARIABLE REACHES 100, THE BAR IS FILLED.
THIS TURNS THE BME SWITCH OFF AND ACTIVATES SWITCH 209: BME SUCCESS
ADJUST THE BAR IMAGE TO SHOW HOW MUCH THE PLAYER HAS FILLED.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER IS PRESSING CONFIRM. IF SO, THE BME VARIABLE WILL INCREASE.
YOU CAN ADJUST THIS NUMBER TO CHANGE THE DIFFICULTY OF THE BUTTON MASH EVENT.
IF THE BAR SOMEHOW DECREASES BELOW ZERO, THIS CONDITIONAL BRANCH WILL
SET IT BACK TO EXACTLY ZERO TO STOP THE BAR GOING BACKWARDS.
IF THE BAR SOMEHOW INCREASES ABOVE 100, THIS CONDITIONAL BRANCH WILL
SET IT BACK TO EXACTLY 100 TO STOP THE BAR OVERFILLING.
OVER TIME, THIS GRADUALLY DECREASES THE BAR'S PROGRESS BY A CERTAIN AMOUNT.
YOU CAN ADJUST THIS TO CHANGE THE DIFFICULTY OF THE BUTTON MASH EVENT.
YOU CAN ALSO DELETE IT TO STOP THE BAR FROM DECREASING AT ALL.
IF THE BAR SOMEHOW DECREASES BELOW ZERO, THIS CONDITIONAL BRANCH WILL
SET IT BACK TO EXACTLY ZERO TO STOP THE BAR GOING BACKWARDS.
ADJUST THE BAR IMAGE TO SHOW HOW MUCH THE PLAYER HAS FILLED.
A WAIT FRAME FOR HOW QUICKLY THE BAR WILL DECREASE.
YOU CAN ADJUST THIS TO MAKE IT DECREASE FASTER OR SLOWER.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER IS PRESSING THE CONFIRM BUTTON.
YOU CAN CHANGE THIS TO CHANGE WHICH BUTTON THE PLAYER
MUST PRESS TO TILL THE GROUND.
CHECK THE PLAYER'S X AND Y COORDINATES AND STORE THEM IN VARIABLES.
DEPENDING ON THE PLAYER'S LOCATION AND DIRECTION, THESE CONDITIONAL
BRANCHES CHECK THAT THERE'S NOT AN EVENT IN FRONT OF THE PLAYER.
GET THE REGION ID OF THE TILE IN FRONT OF THE PLAYER.
CHECK THE PLAYER HAS THE HOE EQUIPPED.
YOU CAN CHOOSE TO PLAY AN ANIMATION WHEN THE CHARACTER SWINGS THE HOE.
THESE ARE CONTROLLED IN COMMON EVENT 118: PLAYER ANIMATIONS.
THE VARIABLE FOR THE HOE ANIMATION IS SET TO 1.
USE THE VISUSTELLA EVENTS AND MOVEMENT CORE TO SPAWN THE TILLED GROUND EVENT
PLEASE CHECK MAP 001: EVENTS TO VIEW THESE EVENT TEMPLATES, AND MAKE SURE THE
TEMPLATE IS CORRECTLY SET UP IN THE PLUGIN'S PARAMETERS.
Spawn Event: Spawn At X, Y
CHECK IF THE PLAYER IS PRESSING PAGE UP TO CHANGE TOOL.
YOU CAN CHANGE THIS TO CHANGE WHICH KEY NEEDS TO BE PRESSED.
DEPENDING ON WHICH TOOL IS ALREADY SELECTED, THE EVENTS WILL
JUMP TO A NEW LABEL WHEN PAGE UP IS PRESSED TO SHOW THE NEXT TOOL.
CHECK IF THE PLAYER HAS THE RELEVANT ITEM. IF NOT, THE UI
WILL SKIP TO THE NEXT TOOL.
THE FOLLOWING EVENTS WILL SET UP WHICH UI PICTURE TO SHOW,
DEPENDING ON WHICH TOOL IS SELECTED OR HOW FULL THE
IF YOU ARE USING A DAY/NIGHT SYSTEM OR WANT TO CREATE YOUR OWN
EVENTS FOR A BED OR OTHER WAY TO PASS THE TIME, COPY AND PASTE

THE PLAYER MUST BE TELEPORTED TO ALL MAPS WITH POTENTIAL CROP EVENTS AND

COPY AND PASTE THE FOLLOWING EVENTS AND CHANGE THEM FOR EACH CROP MAP.

RETURN THE PLAYER TO THEIR ORIGINAL MAP.
DISABLE OTHER COOKIE CUTTER UI SYSTEMS WHILE THE RELATIONSHIP MENU IS OPEN.

parameters.text:
Birthday: \c[3]Spring 1\c[0]
A sweet, mysterious girl who looks oddly 
familiar..
She protects the town from monsters, and
likes to explore out in the wild.

blacksmith's shop.
He loves all things spicy and sweet,
and takes his coffee like rocket fuel.

holes in things.

just outside of town.

no one is entirely sure what he does..
He only shows even the smallest smile
when he's totally ecstatic.

brewer.
Her favorite thing in the world is tea.

hot cocoa, even in the hottest weather.

Birthday: \c[3]Spring 9\c[0]
After failing to become a doctor in the 
city, she treats the ailments of the 
townspeople instead.
She hates any form of exercise.
